intro: Swartzia brachyrhachis var. brachyrhachis, commonly known as the short-stemmed swartzia, is a tropical tree native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in humid lowland forests and can reach heights of up to 20 meters. Its bark is often marked with distinctive fissures, and it produces small, fragrant flowers that attract various pollinators. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
